comment: Professor Stokes seems like a nice guy but that doesn't cut it. I can't recommend him. He contradicts himself from time to time and even doesn't know how to solve a problem here and there. He gives extra credit for tests but only because the class does so bad on his tests. He is a harsh grader and takes WEEKS to grade a simple assignment.

Often contradicts himself in between solving a problem, and I learned all the material through previous knowledge and hw. Inconsistent with grading, grades everything last min, and uploads docs the night before the test. KSU also randomly switched my prof to this guy with no notice, only good thing is office hours he explains more in detail.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Lectures can be a bit boring but if you're interested in physics this class would definitely be worth it.

Dr. Stokes is a nice guy, but he is not a great professor. His lectures are basically copy and paste from the textbook, and wouldn't know how to answer questions about the material. He is very disorganized, and inconsistent to follow throughout lectures. I aced AP physics in high school, yet I'm on the verge of a C because of his teaching style.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
Please find a different professor. He struggles to explain basic concepts and over complicates things.

If you are still undecided, here is poem from the depths of my soul:

Dr. Stokes never tells jokes,
It is my GPA that he strokes.
Every lecture in his class,
Reminds me I'm not going to pass.
If you want your GPA to die,
Please take this guy.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: His class was very easy, the only issue was that he would grade stuff very late.
Super easy class, grades things way late but gives a lot of 100s and As, even for things turned in late. Just do the work and you'll do great.

A lot of the class was a guest speaker. With that, Prof. Stokes is very understanding regarding assignment deadlines; he understands if something comes up as long as you communicate with him. He wants everyone in the class to pass and understand how the college operates.
When it comes to questions he is very helpful. We mostly have guest speakers. He understands if something personal is going on and will give you more time on assignments.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: He's a vey good professor. His lectures can be boring, and seem pointless, but he explains everything you need to do to complete his work, he is caring and lenient. He is willing to help if your are struggling with completing his projects, and is overall very understanding. I would definitely recommend taking this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: Only graded by weekly homework, test and quizzes in recitation. Easy material but he is terrible at explaining and sometimes has to clarify wron information he said. If you can sit through boring lectures all semester then this class will great. Easy class but professor isnt the best.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: He's very old-fashioned when it comes to lectures. Prefers that students do not use technology to take notes, but all in all, he is a good professor. Knows a lot about physics and will answer any questions if confused.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY
